means: 一般地，广泛地，大众地，通俗地

sentence.Network_en: Schizophrenia is not a "split mind" as is popularly believed.
sentence.Network_cn: 精神分裂症并非人们普遍认为的那样是“分裂的精神”。

sentence.Network_en: Walesa was Poland's first popularly elected President.
sentence.Network_cn: 瓦文萨是波兰第一任民选总统。

all in all , the research that Krueger gathers together suggests that if there is a link between poverty , education and terrorism , it is the opposite of the one popularly assumed .总而言之，克鲁格收集的研究结果显示，如果说贫穷、教育和恐怖主义之间有联系的话，那也是与人们的普遍看法相反。
Boris Yeltsin arrived in the U.S. , fresh from his victory in becoming the first popularly elected Russian president .刚刚旗开得胜成为俄国第一个民选总统的叶利钦，来到美国。

entry.tran: （相对于正式名称）通俗地，一般地
entry.def: If something or someone is popularly known as something, most people call them that, although it is not their official name or title.

example.ex: ...the Mesozoic era, more popularly known as the age of dinosaurs.
example.tran: 中生代，即一般所称的恐龙时代

example.ex: ...an infection popularly called mad cow disease.

entry.def: If something is popularly believed or supposed to be the case, most people believe or suppose it to be the case, although it may not be true.

example.ex: Schizophrenia is not a 'split mind' as is popularly believed...
example.tran: 精神分裂症并非人们普遍认为的那样是“分裂的精神”。

example.ex: She possessed the vibrant personality that is so often popularly associated with Spanish women.
example.tran: 她拥有通常会令人联想到西班牙女性的火热个性。

entry.def: A popularly elected leader or government has been elected by a majority of the people in a country.

example.ex: Walesa was Poland's first popularly elected President.
example.tran: 瓦文萨是波兰第一任民选总统。
